001package imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters;
002
003import imagingbook.lib.image.access.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
004import imagingbook.lib.math.VectorNorm.NormType;
005import imagingbook.lib.util.ParameterBundle;
006
007public interface BilateralF {
008        
009        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle {
010                /** Sigma (width) of domain filter */
011                public double sigmaD = 2;               
012                /** Sigma (width) of range filter */
013                public double sigmaR = 50;
014                /** Distance norm to use between color vectors */
015                public NormType colorNormType = NormType.L2;
016                /** Out-of-bounds strategy */
017                public OutOfBoundsStrategy obs = OutOfBoundsStrategy.NearestBorder;
018        }
019        
020        // ------------------------------------------------------
021        
022        public static float gauss(double d, double sigmaR2) {
023                return (float) Math.exp(-(d * d) / (2 * sigmaR2));
024        }
025        
026        // This returns the weights for a Gaussian range kernel (scalar version):
027//      protected static float similarityGauss(float a, float b, double sigmaR2) {
028//              //double dI = a - b;
029//              return gauss(a - b, sigmaR2);
030//              //return (float) Math.exp(-(dI * dI) / (2 * sigmaR2));
031//      }
032        
033//      @SuppressWarnings("unused")
034//      // for better efficiency: pre-tabulated version of the range kernel - CHECK!
035//      private float[] makeRangeKernel(double sigma, int K) {
036//              int size = K + 1 + K;
037//              float[] rangeKernel = new float[size]; //center cell = kernel[K]
038//              double sigma2 = sigma * sigma;
039//              for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
040//                      double x = K - i;
041//                      rangeKernel[i] =  (float) Math.exp(-0.5 * (x*x) / sigma2);
042//              }
043//              return rangeKernel;
044//      }
045
046}
